storyInfo: Noble heir Michael of Lupukarn is summoned to the capital for his 'education.' Despite his modest status, he secures an audience with the intimidating Twin Empresses and strives to gain opportunities for his homeland.

attributes.content: December 28th, 5:00 P.M.
Zwillingstürme, in front of the Twin Empresses' Spires
Michael, holding a tuba that's too heavy for him, leads his band to follow the attendant who receives them to the Twin Spires.
Herr Michael, when you left Lupukarn, the preparations for the New Year celebration should already have been underway, yes?
attributes.name: Receiving Attendant

attributes.content: Yes.
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: And just call me Michael.
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: Very well then.
attributes.name: Receiving Attendant

attributes.content: I really miss that town. The sunset might not be as brilliant as the one in Zwillingstürme, but the smell of freshly baked crullers... There's nothing better.
attributes.name: Receiving Attendant

attributes.content: I didn't expect you to arrive so soon. I thought...
attributes.name: Receiving Attendant

attributes.content: I thought you'd at least spend the New Year in your own spire.
attributes.name: Receiving Attendant

attributes.content: True, this might have been my last chance to spend one back in Lupukarn. All the heirs sent to Zwillingstürme to 'study'—who knows when we'll be able to go back home?
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: But it was my own decision to rush here for the New Year celebration.
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: You wanted to take part in the festivities?
attributes.name: Receiving Attendant

attributes.content: I plan to submit my application to the Kaiserinnen during my audience today. As Father advised, to ensure equal trade for Lupukarn, we must first seek Their Majesties' approval.
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: But Their Majesties... Ah, Michael, I'm not allowed to go any further. I've never been inside, but the Spire of Grace should be over that way.
attributes.name: Receiving Attendant

attributes.content: You've never been inside? Then who has been delivering all the official documents from Lupukarn to Their Majesties over the past few years?
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: *sigh* When Their Majesties don't want to listen, very few 'noises' reach their ears. The neighboring nobles are well aware of this.
attributes.name: Receiving Attendant

attributes.content: Anyway, you must be extremely careful when speaking with them. I've heard bad things.
attributes.name: Receiving Attendant

attributes.content: Especially concerning Grimmacht—she's the one who nearly flattened our town. I've heard that if anyone misspeaks, even a single word, she'll slice them in two with her sword!
attributes.name: Receiving Attendant

attributes.content: Do not take this lightly! Try to limit your conversation to Her Majesty Ewigegnade, who is kinder and gentler. After all, your safety is what matters most.
attributes.name: Receiving Attendant

attributes.content: Don't worry. I've been preparing for this meeting for a whole year. I shan't be foolish.
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: From my self-introduction, to the music arrangements, to every last word in my New Year celebration application, I've already worn out several pens just writing it all down.
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: Besides, for the first time, a wolf from Lupukarn is being allowed to step into the sheep's Spire. Isn't this a sign of progress?
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: ...I wish you the best of luck, Michael.
attributes.name: Receiving Attendant

attributes.content: Michael steps onto the unfamiliar and overly wide path.
(Breathe, breathe!)
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: (There's only one Kaiserin present, along with some civil and military officials? So the terrifying Grimmacht isn't here?)
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: (Good, then I won't be needing all those speeches I prepared especially for her.)
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: As he steps forward, he can hear his heart pounding. He bows to Ewigegnade, his movements steady and restrained, just as he has rehearsed countless times.
Your Majesty, I come on behalf of my family.
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: Hello, Michael. How are you finding life in the city?
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: Excellent, Your Majesty. There are so many sights and sounds here that simply do not exist in Lupukarn.
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: Having witnessed the prosperity of the capital, I am even more eager for Lupukarn to follow in its footsteps under the twin beacons of Eternal Grace and Austere Authority.
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: Michael's palms tighten for a moment. His answer, smooth and fluent, contains a nearly imperceptible pause, a result of his nervousness.
He steals a glance at Ewigegnade, and sees that her smile remains warm, as if encouraging him not to fear. Michael relaxes just a bit.
I see you've brought your band. What sort of performance will you be giving us?
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: We will play a piece from Lupukarn, called 'White Fang.'
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: It tells the story of wild beasts that survive by eating raw flesh in the jungle. One day, as they reach the edge of the jungle, they are drawn in by the sound of music from afar.
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: And so, they sheath their fangs, leave their home, and respond to its call.
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: (She understands the meaning behind my choice! And she seems pleased... Wunderbar!)
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: Let's hear your interpretation of it, then.
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: Of course. Allow me to present this performance to Her Majesty on behalf of Lupukarn!
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: The music echoes throughout the Spire. The treble is lively and bright, and the bass is gentle and docile, as the young Lupo from Lupukarn sheathes his fangs before the Kaiserin.
The piece undoubtedly suits Ewigegnade's tastes. However, to leave an even stronger impression, Michael adds a personal touch during the final tuba solo.
A-one and-a-two and-a-three and-a-four—the band falls silent. Michael steps forward and begins his meticulously practiced (and brilliantly executed) solo.
The solo as originally written was simple and heartfelt, but that wouldn't align with Ewigegnade's preference for grandeur and elegance.
So, Michael adds smooth glissandi to give every pitch a richer, more refined color.
The resplendent Spire of Grace, the colorful silk brocades fluttering in every corner, and the breathtaking sunset—
They perfectly complement the magnificent and masterful performance, creating an orchestra tailored to Ewigegnade's taste. It is brilliant; it is radiant; it is, fortunately, flawlessly performed!
All the preparation Michael had done over the past year was worth it. His heart races with excitement. He slowly lowers the tuba, eagerly stealing more glances at Ewigegnade.
(Great, she looks just as kind and gentle as before.)
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: (...But the expression on her face hasn't changed one bit?)
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: Michael and the band bow to Ewigegnade.
Mm. A fine choice of music.
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: The arrangement was thoughtfully done.
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: You certainly put your heart and soul into this.
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: We are honored to receive your praise, Your Majesty.
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: Actually, Your Majesty, I came here today to deliver a message from my father.
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: He humbly requests that you allow the Lupukarn nobility to participate in the New Year celebrations...
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: Speak no more of this. Your performance was exquisite, and I wish to savor it without distraction. We shall discuss it later.
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: Michael's palms grow cold and sweaty.
If it pleases Your Majesty, could we perhaps set a date?
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: Lupukarn is eager to keep pace with the other provinces and longs for an opportunity to help build a better Lethanien.
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: Your passion for music has already been conveyed through your performance. Forget the New Year celebration. I have another, more suitable plan, for you.
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: From now on, you will work at Matti's spire. It houses a treasure trove of ancient musical scores. Given your passion for music, I can think of no better place for you.
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: Little wolf of the jungle, are you satisfied with my arrangements?
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: Michael feels the instrument in his hands grow heavier, sending a sharp pain up his arms. He struggles to hold it up.
Ancient musical scores, far from the Kaiserinnen's Spires... How long would he be left in neglect? He could only wonder.
It is as if the rest of his life has been decided in such a short meeting. Given the circumstances, he cannot refuse the kind and gentle Ewigegnade...
I... Your Majest...
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: Everyone turns to face the sound of the door creaking open. The other Kaiserin of Lethanien, Grimmacht, stands in the doorway.
The one who, two years ago, personally led the campaign to suppress the rebellion in Lupukarn with absolute force. The embodiment of Austere Authority. Michael's face grows even paler.
Grimmacht...
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: You've arrived. It's a pity you're late. You missed the wonderful performance of this young man from Lupukarn.
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: I heard it from outside. It was absolutely dreadful.
attributes.name: Grimmacht

attributes.content: Oh? I thought a sharp young man like him would appeal to you.
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: All style and no substance. The arrangement for the final solo was particularly unbearable.
attributes.name: Grimmacht

attributes.content: That's really a shame. I was even thinking of sending him to Matti's spire to study.
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: Study? With that level of 'talent', he should just head back to Lupukarn as soon as possible.
attributes.name: Grimmacht

attributes.content: ...Yes. I'll... take my leave, then.
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: I see you're still busy with the New Year celebrations, Lieselotte? Matters like this should be handled by the Empresses' Voice. There's no need for you to waste your time with it.
attributes.name: Stern Voice from Behind

attributes.content: The voice of Lupakarn needed an audience.
attributes.name: Gentle Voice From Behind

attributes.content: If you don't listen, won't the voices still slip into your ears from every corner?
attributes.name: Gentle Voice From Behind

attributes.content: In which case it's better to be open and meet them face to face.
attributes.name: Gentle Voice From Behind

attributes.content: Michael cannot hear Grimmacht's response. He has already reached the door and is too nervous to linger any longer.
(The voice of Lupukarn? Weren't all the letters from home, sent through official channels, rejected? Could someone be...?)
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: Kaiserin Grimmacht, please, wait. Forgive my impertinence, but I wanted to thank you for your help just now.
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: Kaiserin Grimmacht, please...
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: I think that... I know that your appearance here wasn't a coincidence.
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: Michael's words, thrown out in desperation, finally cause Grimmacht to stop. He watches the silent Empress, her back turned to him, as he struggles to swallow the lump in his throat.
As I see it, the attendants who have remained neglected outside the Spires for years, and I, who was reprimanded just after arriving, are all an extension of Your Majesties' attitudes.
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: A young man from Lupukarn is publicly put on the spot by one Kaiserin, only to be spared by another—this can't be a coincidence.
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: Among the audience of this play are the nobles, as well as the heirs of Lupukarn nobles who have gone to their wits' ends to send their letters to the Kaiserinnen.
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: Michael observes Grimmacht for a moment, but her motionless posture reveals nothing.
...Was I the lead actor in this play? I still do not know. Perhaps Your Majesties disapprove of my father's stance, or perhaps it's just that my timing was unfortunate.
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: I only know that Your Majesty saved me.
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: If my suspicions are correct, you did that to send us a message.
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: If so, then I am even more certain that Your Majesties still have mercy for Lupukarn.
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: From your exchange with Lieselotte, I thought you would be a more cautious child.
attributes.name: Grimmacht

attributes.content: I know Your Majesty prefers to be straightforward, and hence my candor.
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: You said you did not like today's piece.
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: Actually, neither did I.
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: Which is why I risked offending you, just to wait for you here.
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: I know many more pieces, if only you'll give me the chance to play them for you!
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: Grimmacht walks away in silence, as if Michael's words are mere noise. As he watches her retreating silhouette, his heart sinks deeper into despair with each passing moment.
Suddenly, the Kaiserin stops. Michael isn't sure, but her head seems to turn back ever so slightly. He waits for her instructions, but there are none. She keeps walking again.
An unprecedented impulse surges through him, as if he knows it is now or never. Without questioning his eyes or judgment, he catches up to her without hesitation.
